page.title: 19LONGFORGAN - BORSTAL LIFE -
page.content: Inmates rise at 6.15 am to wash and dress, and room inspection at 7.00 am. Inmates then go to the dining room for breakfast. Inmate work parties then go to the farm, the workshops and the gardens where they work from 8 am till 4 pm with a 1 hour lunchbreak, and teabreaks at 10 o'clock and 3 o'clock. After work the inmates have their tea in the dining room and then they are locked in their rooms till 6.15 pm and this allows the officers to be fed. The inmates are then allowed out for recreation time. Supper is at 8.30 pm and the inmates are locked up at 9 pm and the lights are out at 11 o'clock. Night classes and education are encouraged. After 4 months an inmate can be upgraded which gives 1 open visit each month, going swimming on Saturday morning, and to a football match on Saturday afternoon.
